metadata.title: CVE-2024-45296 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: path-to-regexp turns path strings into a regular expressions. In certaincases, path-to-regexp will output a regular expression that can beexploited to cause poor performance. Because JavaScript is single threadedand regex matching runs on the main thread, poor performance will block theevent loop and lead to a DoS. The bad regular expression is generated anytime you have two parameters within a single segment, separated bysomething that is not a period (.). For users of 0.1, upgrade to 0.1.10.All other users should upgrade to 8.0.0.

criterions.comment: node-path-to-regexp package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
